newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL tin down 27 cents on London's fall, adjustment.
newsitem.headline: KL tin down 27 cents on London's fall, adjustment.

text.p: Malaysia's tin price ended down 27 cents at 14.59 ringgit ($5.88) a kg, pressured by large offerings on the back of a sharp fall on the London Metal Exchange (LME) overnight, traders said.
Traders also attributed the drop to a technical adjustment after a 45-cent jump on Thursday.
"After the sharp fall in London and big jump here yesterday, we had expected some reaction," said one trader.
He said he expected the wide fluctuations to continue given the volatility of the copper market.
There were initial offers for 146 tonnes against bids for 49 tonnes. Final turnover was 115 tonnes, down from 160 on Thursday, and buyers were from Europe, Japan and Malaysia.
The premium over the LME narrowed to $55 a tonne against $90 previously, traders said.
